verses.verse: The men <S%H376><s%> of Ephraim <S%H669><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to him, <S%H4100><s%> "Why have you treated <S%H6213><s%> us this <S%H1697><s%> way, <S%H4100><s%> that you didn't <S%H7121><s%> call us, <S%H1980><s%> when you went to fight <S%H3898><s%> with Midian? <S%H4080><s%>" They rebuked him sharply. <S%H2394><s%>

He said <S%H559><s%> to them, <S%H6213><s%> "What have I now done in comparison with you? <S%H5955><s%> Isn't the gleaning of the grapes of Ephraim <S%H669><s%> better <S%H2896><s%> than the vintage <S%H1210><s%> of Abiezer? <S%H44><s%>

God <S%H430><s%> has delivered <S%H5414><s%> into your hand <S%H3027><s%> the princes <S%H8269><s%> of Midian, <S%H4080><s%> Oreb <S%H6159><s%> and Zeeb! <S%H2062><s%> What was I able <S%H3201><s%> to do <S%H6213><s%> in comparison with you? <S%H7307><s%>" Then their anger was abated <S%H7503><s%> toward him, <S%H1697><s%> when he had said that. <S%H1696><s%>

Gideon <S%H1439><s%> came <S%H935><s%> to the Jordan, <S%H3383><s%> and passed over, <S%H5674><s%> he, <S%H7969><s%> and the three hundred <S%H3967><s%> men <S%H376><s%> who were with him, <S%H5889><s%> faint, yet pursuing. <S%H7291><s%>

He said <S%H559><s%> to the men <S%H582><s%> of Succoth, <S%H5523><s%> "Please give <S%H5414><s%> loaves <S%H3603><s%> of bread <S%H3899><s%> to the people <S%H5971><s%> who follow <S%H7272><s%> me; <S%H5889><s%> for they are faint, and I am pursuing <S%H7291><s%> after <S%H310><s%> Zebah <S%H2078><s%> and Zalmunna, <S%H6759><s%> the kings <S%H4428><s%> of Midian. <S%H4080><s%>"

The princes <S%H8269><s%> of Succoth <S%H5523><s%> said, <S%H559><s%> "Are the hands <S%H3709><s%> of Zebah <S%H2078><s%> and Zalmunna <S%H6759><s%> now in your hand, <S%H3027><s%> that we should give <S%H5414><s%> bread <S%H3899><s%> to your army? <S%H6635><s%>"

Gideon <S%H1439><s%> said, <S%H559><s%> "Therefore when Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> has delivered <S%H5414><s%> Zebah <S%H2078><s%> and Zalmunna <S%H6759><s%> into my hand, <S%H3027><s%> then I will tear <S%H1758><s%> your flesh <S%H1320><s%> with the thorns <S%H6975><s%> of the wilderness <S%H4057><s%> and with briers. <S%H1303><s%>"

He went up <S%H5927><s%> there to Penuel, <S%H6439><s%> and spoke <S%H1696><s%> to them in the same <S%H2063><s%> way; <S%H582><s%> and the men of Penuel <S%H6439><s%> answered <S%H6030><s%> him as the men <S%H582><s%> of Succoth <S%H5523><s%> had answered. <S%H6030><s%>

He spoke <S%H559><s%> also to the men <S%H582><s%> of Penuel, <S%H6439><s%> saying, <S%H559><s%> "When I come again <S%H7725><s%> in peace, <S%H7965><s%> I will break down <S%H5422><s%> this tower. <S%H4026><s%>"

Now Zebah <S%H2078><s%> and Zalmunna <S%H6759><s%> were in Karkor, <S%H7174><s%> and their armies <S%H4264><s%> with them, <S%H2568><s%> about fifteen thousand <S%H505><s%> men, <S%H3498><s%> all who were left of all the army <S%H4264><s%> of the children <S%H1121><s%> of the east; <S%H6924><s%> for there fell <S%H5307><s%> one hundred <S%H3967><s%> twenty <S%H6242><s%> thousand <S%H505><s%> men <S%H376><s%> who drew <S%H8025><s%> sword. <S%H2719><s%>

Gideon <S%H1439><s%> went up <S%H5927><s%> by the way <S%H1870><s%> of those who lived <S%H7931><s%> in tents <S%H168><s%> on the east <S%H6924><s%> of Nobah <S%H5025><s%> and Jogbehah, <S%H3011><s%> and struck <S%H5221><s%> the army; <S%H4264><s%> for the army <S%H4264><s%> was secure. <S%H983><s%>

Zebah <S%H2078><s%> and Zalmunna <S%H6759><s%> fled; <S%H5127><s%> and he pursued <S%H7291><s%> after <S%H310><s%> them; <S%H3920><s%> and he took the two <S%H8147><s%> kings <S%H4428><s%> of Midian, <S%H4080><s%> Zebah <S%H2078><s%> and Zalmunna, <S%H6759><s%> and confused <S%H2729><s%> all the army. <S%H4264><s%>
Gideon <S%H1439><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Joash <S%H3101><s%> returned <S%H7725><s%> from the battle <S%H4421><s%> from <S%H4608><s%> the ascent of Heres. <S%H2775><s%>

He caught <S%H3920><s%> a young man <S%H5288><s%> of the men <S%H582><s%> of Succoth, <S%H5523><s%> and inquired <S%H7592><s%> of him: <S%H3789><s%> and he described for him the princes <S%H8269><s%> of Succoth, <S%H5523><s%> and its elders, <S%H2205><s%> seventy-seven <S%H7657><s%> men. <S%H376><s%>

He came <S%H935><s%> to the men <S%H582><s%> of Succoth, <S%H5523><s%> and said, <S%H559><s%> "See Zebah <S%H2078><s%> and Zalmunna, <S%H6759><s%> concerning whom you taunted <S%H2778><s%> me, <S%H559><s%> saying, <S%H3709><s%> 'Are the hands of Zebah <S%H2078><s%> and Zalmunna <S%H6759><s%> now in your hand, <S%H3709><s%> that we should give <S%H5414><s%> bread <S%H3899><s%> to your men <S%H582><s%> who are weary? <S%H3287><s%>'"

He took <S%H3947><s%> the elders <S%H2205><s%> of the city, <S%H5892><s%> and thorns <S%H6975><s%> of the wilderness <S%H4057><s%> and briers, <S%H1303><s%> and with them he taught <S%H3045><s%> the men <S%H582><s%> of Succoth. <S%H5523><s%>
He broke down <S%H5422><s%> the tower <S%H4026><s%> of Penuel, <S%H6439><s%> and killed <S%H2026><s%> the men <S%H582><s%> of the city. <S%H5892><s%>

Then he said <S%H559><s%> to Zebah <S%H2078><s%> and Zalmunna, <S%H6759><s%> "What <S%H375><s%> kind of men <S%H582><s%> were they whom you killed <S%H2026><s%> at Tabor? <S%H8396><s%>" They answered, <S%H559><s%> "They were like you. <S%H3644><s%> Each one <S%H259><s%> resembled <S%H8389><s%> the children <S%H1121><s%> of a king. <S%H4428><s%>"

He said, <S%H559><s%> "They were my brothers, <S%H251><s%> the sons <S%H1121><s%> of my mother. <S%H517><s%> As Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> lives, <S%H2416><s%> if <S%H3863><s%> you had saved them alive, <S%H2421><s%> I would not kill you. <S%H2026><s%>"

He said <S%H559><s%> to Jether <S%H3500><s%> his firstborn, <S%H1060><s%> "Get up, <S%H6965><s%> and kill <S%H2026><s%> them! <S%H5288><s%>" But the youth didn't <S%H8025><s%> draw his sword; <S%H2719><s%> for he was afraid, <S%H3372><s%> because he was yet a youth. <S%H5288><s%>

Then Zebah <S%H2078><s%> and Zalmunna <S%H6759><s%> said, <S%H559><s%> "Rise <S%H6965><s%> and fall <S%H6293><s%> on us; <S%H376><s%> for as the man is, <S%H1369><s%> so is his strength." Gideon <S%H1439><s%> arose, <S%H6965><s%> and killed <S%H2026><s%> Zebah <S%H2078><s%> and Zalmunna, <S%H6759><s%> and took <S%H3947><s%> the crescents <S%H7720><s%> that were on their camels <S%H1581><s%>' necks. <S%H6677><s%>

Then the men <S%H376><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to Gideon, <S%H1439><s%> "Rule <S%H4910><s%> over us, <S%H1121><s%> both you, and your son, and your son <S%H1121><s%>'s son <S%H1121><s%> also; <S%H3467><s%> for you have saved us out of the hand <S%H3027><s%> of Midian. <S%H4080><s%>"

Gideon <S%H1439><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to them, <S%H4910><s%> "I will not rule over you, <S%H1121><s%> neither shall my son rule <S%H4910><s%> over you. <S%H3068><s%> Yahweh shall rule over you. <S%H4910><s%>"

Gideon <S%H1439><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to them, <S%H7592><s%> "I would make a request <S%H7596><s%> of you, <S%H5414><s%> that you would give me every man <S%H376><s%> the earrings <S%H5141><s%> of his spoil. <S%H7998><s%>" (For they had golden <S%H2091><s%> earrings, <S%H5141><s%> because they were Ishmaelites. <S%H3459><s%>)

They answered, <S%H559><s%> "We will willingly <S%H5414><s%> give <S%H5414><s%> them. <S%H6566><s%>" They spread a garment, <S%H8071><s%> and every man <S%H376><s%> threw <S%H7993><s%> the earrings <S%H5141><s%> of his spoil into it. <S%H7998><s%>

The weight <S%H4948><s%> of the golden <S%H2091><s%> earrings <S%H5141><s%> that he requested <S%H7592><s%> was one thousand <S%H505><s%> and seven <S%H7651><s%> hundred <S%H3967><s%> shekels of gold, <S%H2091><s%> besides the crescents, <S%H7720><s%> and the pendants, <S%H5188><s%> and the purple <S%H713><s%> clothing <S%H899><s%> that was on the kings <S%H4428><s%> of Midian, <S%H4080><s%> and besides the chains <S%H6060><s%> that were about their camels <S%H1581><s%>' necks. <S%H6677><s%>

Gideon <S%H1439><s%> made <S%H6213><s%> an ephod <S%H646><s%> of it, <S%H3322><s%> and put it in his city, <S%H5892><s%> even in Ophrah: <S%H6084><s%> and all Israel <S%H3478><s%> played the prostitute <S%H2181><s%> after <S%H310><s%> it there; <S%H4170><s%> and it became a snare to Gideon, <S%H1439><s%> and to his house. <S%H1004><s%>

So Midian <S%H4080><s%> was subdued <S%H3665><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> the children <S%H1121><s%> of Israel, <S%H3478><s%> and they lifted up <S%H5375><s%> their heads <S%H7218><s%> no more. <S%H3254><s%> The land <S%H776><s%> had rest <S%H8252><s%> forty <S%H705><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> in the days <S%H3117><s%> of Gideon. <S%H1439><s%>
Jerubbaal <S%H3378><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Joash <S%H3101><s%> went <S%H3212><s%> and lived <S%H3427><s%> in his own house. <S%H1004><s%>
Gideon <S%H1439><s%> had seventy <S%H7657><s%> sons <S%H1121><s%> conceived <S%H3318><s%> from his body; <S%H3409><s%> for he had many <S%H7227><s%> wives. <S%H802><s%>
His concubine <S%H6370><s%> who was in Shechem, <S%H7927><s%> she also bore <S%H3205><s%> him a son, <S%H1121><s%> and he named <S%H7760><s%> him <S%H8034><s%> Abimelech. <S%H40><s%>

Gideon <S%H1439><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Joash <S%H3101><s%> died <S%H4191><s%> in a good <S%H2896><s%> old age, <S%H7872><s%> and was buried <S%H6912><s%> in the tomb <S%H6913><s%> of Joash <S%H3101><s%> his father, <S%H1><s%> in Ophrah <S%H6084><s%> of the Abiezrites. <S%H33><s%>

It happened, <S%H1439><s%> as soon as Gideon was dead, <S%H4191><s%> that the children <S%H1121><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> turned again, <S%H7725><s%> and played the prostitute <S%H2181><s%> after <S%H310><s%> the Baals, <S%H1168><s%> and made <S%H7760><s%> Baal Berith <S%H1170><s%> their god. <S%H430><s%>

The children <S%H1121><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> didn't <S%H2142><s%> remember Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> their God, <S%H430><s%> who had delivered <S%H5337><s%> them out of the hand <S%H3027><s%> of all their enemies <S%H341><s%> on every side; <S%H5439><s%>

neither did they show <S%H6213><s%> kindness <S%H2617><s%> to the house <S%H1004><s%> of Jerubbaal, <S%H3378><s%> Gideon, <S%H1439><s%> according to all the goodness <S%H2896><s%> which he had shown <S%H6213><s%> to Israel. <S%H3478><s%>
